quest.name: Devourer of Worlds
journal: Lonu Vanu would like very much for you to enjoy the hospitality of his village.
Out of gratitude to you and Alphinaud, Lonu Vanu invites you to his village, leaving before you can make your excuses. Consult with Alphinaud and decide whether to follow or not.

Surmising that the Vanu may know the whereabouts of the archbishop and the Heavens' Ward, Alphinaud suggests you accept Lonu Vanu's offer of hospitality. Journey to the north and seek out the Vanu youth.

Shortly after you and Alphinaud arrive in the Vanu village, the sound of cannon fire reverberates throughout the Sea of Clouds, sending everyone scrambling to search for the source. When Cid subsequently arrives, he explains that the imperials have engaged Bismarck, and together you turn your eyes heavensward even as the primal's massive body casts a shadow over all. Before your disbelieving eyes, Bismarck opens wide its great maw and swallows an island whole. At this, Lonu Vanu cries out with a mixture of rage and despair, but refuses to dwell on the actions of an unfathomable god, instead urging you to speak with Sonu Vanu, chieftain of the Zundu.

Chief Sonu reveals that the archbishop and the Heavens' Ward are come to the Sea of Clouds in search of the key to Azys Lla, a land of forbidden secrets. However, their quest has been complicated by the fact that Bismarck, the insatiable white whale, has devoured the island upon which the key was kept. Though some might think the belly of a primal an ideal repository for so dangerous an artifact, Alphinaud's expression makes it abundantly clear that he is not one of them.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Lonu Vanu owes much and more to netherlings. As saviors, as heroes, Zundu welcome you!

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: To village we go! To north! Come, come!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And so we live to fight another day...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Imperial troops? Here? Well, hopefully that's the last of them. We'll keep our eyes open, either way.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Garleans!? Understood. We'll send word to the Temple Knights.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: All quiet here, Forename. No Vanu, no Garleans, nothing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So the Garleans were searching for the archbishop and believed that the Vanu Vanu knew something of his whereabouts.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Methods notwithstanding, they may have had the right of it...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I conclude that we should accept Lonu Vanu's offer of hospitality, and visit his village.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I want to believe Lonu Vanu is sincere in his intentions. Nevertheless, keep your eyes open, Forename.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Like breeze guides leaves to rest, come and lay down your burdens, netherlings! Lonu Vanu throws wide arms in greeting! Behold─Ok' Zundu!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A far warmer welcome than the one you received from the Vundu, I think.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Hah! Vundu bluster and blow hither and yon. Sound and fury, like aimless gale.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Eh!? What unseen lightning begets such thunderous report!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There you are! Did you see it!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's that damned flying whale again! The imperials are after it!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Where!?

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: The White!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: He's wounded!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: By the Twelve... Did the beast just eat that island!?

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: O insatiable White, O devourer of worlds! Why must You torment us!?

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Bah! Lonu Vanu wastes no more words on His unfathomable deeds. Come, netherlings! Come and break words with chief of Zundu!

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: With wisdom deep as nethers and eyes clear as cloudless blue, Sonu Vanu speaks for Zundu. Hearken to his words!

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Netherlings deliver Lonu Vanu from claws of steel-shod fiends and prove nobility. He knows not to ignore zephyr winds, and brings before you with all haste.

dialogue.name: SONUVANU
dialogue.text: Soft rains to soothe the heart and sunshine to warm. Gratitude of Sonu, chief of Zundu, is boundless.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are honored to meet you, Chief Sonu. I am Alphinaud Leveilleur, and these are my companions Forename Surname and Cid Garlond.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are come in search of an airship─a flying vessel of the nethers─which we believe is somewhere in the cloud sea.

dialogue.name: SONUVANU
dialogue.text: Ah, like to black steel-shod contraption from which you save Lonu Vanu?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Alas, no. That ship belongs to the Garlean Empire─an old enemy of ours...though not the enemy we are looking for at present.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The men we seek wear armor of purest white, and are led by an older man in white robes.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Wait! Lonu Vanu hear tell of these netherlings!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You do? Are you certain?

dialogue.name: SONUVANU
dialogue.text: As sun rises and falls and returns, we are. Zundu scouts can testify to words of Lonu Vanu.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Aye, aye! Winds carry purpose of netherlings to our ears as well. Netherlings seek key to Azys Lla!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Now we're getting somewhere! Tell us, Chief Sonu: what exactly is this “Azys Lla”?

dialogue.name: SONUVANU
dialogue.text: Beware, netherlings, for blackest clouds portend greatest danger. Look not into heart of tempest. There lies ancient birthplace of sin, home of forbidden secrets. To speak more is to call the wind!

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: But the White devours isle where key is kept. Deep within bowels of mighty Bismarck, it lies, beyond reach of the foolhardy!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And beyond ours...

dialogue.name: SONUVANU
dialogue.text: Rejoice not in His gluttony, Lonu Vanu, for as stone gives way to water and wind, all yields to the White.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: This he knows, Chief Sonu. Madness of Vundu bodes ill for all Vanu...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: When you described it as a “flying feathered whale,” I naturally assumed you had taken some liberties...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It'll take a lot more than imperial cannons to bring that beast down...
